title: Panic crash during node sync (slice bounds out of range [:32] with capacity 4
body:
#### System information

Erigon version: `erigon version 2.40.1-stable-94b4cee5`

OS & Version: `Debian GNU/Linux 11 (bullseye)`

uname -r (kernel version): `5.10.0-21-amd64`

go version: `go version go1.20.2 linux/amd64`

Commit hash: `stable branch`

Erigon Command (with flags/config):
`erigon --datadir=~/ethereum --snapshots=true --prune=hrtc --torrent.download.rate=512mb --torrent.upload.rate=256mb  --fakepow=true`

Concensus Layer: Not sure what to put there, did not change anything and just ran the above command

Concensus Layer Command (with flags/config): Did not change anything

Chain/Network: Ethereum mainnet

#### Expected behaviour

I was synching the node since 3-4 days, I hope it would sync.

#### Actual behaviour

At step [8/15 HashState] it just crashed

#### Steps to reproduce the behaviour

I first ran these commands to prevent localhost connections: https://github.com/ledgerwatch/erigon/issues/6034#issuecomment-1355853027
I just ran the command above in a fresh linux.

Seems you have some bad value in db. Maybe hardware corruption (or no space left on disk). 

Can you try: 
use tools like https://www.memtest86.com to test RAM and tools like https://www.smartmontools.org to test Disk

also can try:
make db-tools
./build/bin/mdbx_chk <datadir>/chaindata
